name: electricity production, wind, <1MW turbine, onshore | electricity, high voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19865/documentation

This dataset represents the production of high voltage electricity at onshore grid-connected wind power plants with a capacity of less than 1 MW in Argentina during 2014. The operative wind power plants during that year were Sea energy-Necochea and Diadema, with a net electricity production of 0.029 TWH  All of them are placed onshore. ;The exchanges and parameters for electricity production have been taken from the “electricity production, wind, <1 MW turbine, onshore, GLO, 2008” dataset (accessed: February 2nd, 2018). ;Wind load hours have been calculated from the electricity production volume and the installed capacity;The dataset includes operation and maintenance expenditures as well as infrastructure inputs. ;This dataset is based on the "electricity production, wind, <1MW turbine, onshore"/ GLO 2008 dataset, in which the class of onshore < 1MW wind turbines is approximated with a 0.8 MW onshore wind turbine consisting of the infrastructure datasets for 'moving parts' and 'fixed parts'. Moving parts are the rotor, the nacelle, electronics, and the network connection. The tower and foundation are considered as fixed parts.;According to The Wind Power Database (2014), total installed wind capacity on-and offshore in Switzerland in the end of 2014 amounted to 60 MW. Out of it, 0% were installed offshore, which are modelled with a 2 MW wind turbine. Percentages of the three onshore wind power plant classes modelled in ecoinvent referring to the total installed capacity (12 windfarms by 12/2014): <1MW 8.8%; 1-3MW 91.2%; >3MW 0% [Retreived from The Wind Power. 2014. Wind power and wind farms database. www.thewindpower.net, Status December 2014].;Literature value/calculated value. Valid for 2014. According to CAMMESA during 2014  only 191 MW were operative:  <1MW 3.43 %; 1-3MW 96,57 %. Source: CAMMESA "COMPAÑÍA ADMINISTRADORA DEL MERCADO MAYORISTA ELÉCTRICO SOCIEDAD ANÓNIMA"Supporting documentation available at: http://portalweb.cammesa.com/Memnet1/default.aspx. ;Additional information available under request. ;A loss of 1% from gross to net is assumed for wind power.

From operation of the wind power plant to high voltage electricity at the plant. The electricity produced with wind turbines in a wind power plant is connected to medium voltage or high voltage systems, depending on the size of the windfarm. Normally, each wind turbine contains a transformer from low voltage to medium voltage. The network connection additionally transforms the electricity to high voltage electricity. It is assumed here, that there are no stand-alone grid-connected small wind turbines and that all electricity is connected to the network in form of high voltage electricity. 

This activity ends with the production of 1kWh of high voltage electricity produced at the power plant and delivered to the grid.

This dataset includes 
 - the operation and maintenance of the wind power plant
 - change of lubricating oil every year

This dataset doesn't include 
 - raw materials extraction, decommissioning and waste treatment as these activities are already included in infrastructure datasets
 - transformation of the electricity produced in order to deliver in to the grid as this is already included in the infrastructure datasets.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The Annual Production Volume is valid for the year 2014.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Technology of a specific 800 kW wind power plant modelled with a dataset for fixed and moving parts each (the latter including the network connection). Moving parts are the rotor, the nacelle, electronics, and the network connection. The tower and foundation are considered as fixed parts.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
The net electricity production volume have been calculated for Argentina for this specific wind power plant class.
The pararmeter “use of lubricating oil for maintenance”has been taken from the "electricity production, wind, <1MW turbine, onshore"/GLO 2008 dataset, (63 kg per year), and the exchange “lubricating oil” has been calculated from that figure.
The exchanges "Energy, kinetic (in wind), converted" and "transport, freight, lorry 7.5-16 metric ton, EURO3" have been taken from the GLO 2008 dataset
The wind load hours have been calculated for this wind power plant class, considering the gross electricity production from this wind power plant class, the gross to net losses and the total on-shore installed capacity
The remaining exchanges and parameters have been calculated and/or extrapolated for Argentina
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
This dataset is based on electricity produced in two wind power plants: HYCHICO P. EOLICO DIADEMA and SEA ENERGY PARQUE EOLICO NECOCHEA. During the reference year the total operative installed capacity of this wind power plant class was 6.55 MW, while their total net electricity production was 29658.5 MWh. 

Source: CAMMESA "COMPAÑÍA ADMINISTRADORA DEL MERCADO MAYORISTA ELÉCTRICO SOCIEDAD ANÓNIMA"Supporting documentation available at: http://portalweb.cammesa.com/Memnet1/default.aspxNOTE:
